info.name: Whodunit
info.attribution:
Room design and layout by LawDawg96 and released to the Public Domain under CC0.

Library image and card back was generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "city park in the spring, cartoon style of Phineas and Ferb --ar 5:8".

Characters on the Person cards were generated in ChatGPT 4, https://chat.openai.com/, using a prompt similar to "Create 20-year-old female cartoon character portrait head and shoulders, style of Phineas and Ferb, amber-colored clothing, holding a book, on a solid white background".

Images on the Place cards were generated using Midjourney using a prompt similar to: "sprit sheet of park benches on a solid white background, overhead view".

Icons on the Weapons cards are available under the Flaticon License:
  • Walking stick by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/walking-stick_2852384
  • Pruning shears by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/shears_809147
  • Baseball bat by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/baseball-bat_1784991
  • Skateboard by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/skateboard_1048312
  • Dog leash by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/leash_3375483
  • Chain by Freepik: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/chain_2944058
The grass field background and wave texture used on the board are available under the Pixabay License:
  • Grass field by Pexels, https://pixabay.com/photos/field-grass-green-lawn-texture-1851064/
  • Waves by Lukas, https://pixabay.com/photos/sea-background-water-surface-2055969/
The envelope for card piles is by mousewax and is in the public domain under CC0.
info.description: Move around locations in a city park to solve a murder by using deduction. If you figure out whodunit, the location, and the weapon, you win.
info.helpText:
Players sit in seats. Press the reset button in the top left of the board to begin. One of each type of card (person, place, weapon) will be set aside in an envelope in the center of the board. The remaining cards will be dealt to player hands. If the distribution is uneven, random players are chosen to get the extra cards. A random player is selected to start.

Roll the dice, move the tokens, and make suggestions/guesses according to the rules. After rolling the dice, the board will highlight the possible squares available for the player to move. These highlights are guidelines only and do not take into account rule restrictions such as not visiting the same square twice in a turn or not being able to pass through a square occupied by another player's pawn. The highlights also do not recognize the impossibility of moving through named areas of the board. Use good judgement and follow the rules when using the highlighted squares.

To reveal a card to a player making the guess, drag it from the hand to the holder beneath the player's seat. Only the player dragging it and the player in the associated seat will be able to see the card's face. After the other player has seen it, drag it back to the hand.

At the end of a turn, press the turn button in the top center of the board.

When a player wants to solve the murder and make an accusation, drag cards from the envelope (one at a time) to the holder beneath the player's seat. Only that player will see the card. To grab the card, be sure to click near the top of the card, away from the envelope. If the accusation was correct, reveal the cards to the other players. If not, drag the cards back to the center of the board and continue play.

fields.text: This will reset the game. Are you sure?

clickRoutine: // Make the answer cards and pile not clickable until dragged out of the holder
// Deal remaining cards out to players
